abstract: German Chancellor Angela Merkel meets with lawmakers within her conservative bloc to defuse revolt over Greek bailout deal; 65 of 311 deputies in bloc refused to vote for opening negotiations on deal in July; potential for further opposition within bloc to upcoming vote on deal poses one of biggest challenges to Merkel's authority in her 10-year tenure.
lead_paragraph: Despite a rebellion in Parliament, the German chancellor is expected to win approval of the 86-billion-euro bailout package for Greece in a Wednesday vote.

headline.main: German Vote on Bailout Carries Risks for Merkel
headline.print_headline: German Vote on Bailout Plan Carries Risk for Merkel

snippet: Despite a rebellion in Parliament, the German chancellor is expected to win approval of the 86-billion-euro bailout package for Greece in a Wednesday vote.
